technology.short_description: Battle-hungry marauders wade into the foe, enmity and malice powering their blows against anything within reach.

effects.description:
Speed: +10% for Melee Marauder, Kurgan Hunters, Mounted Kurgan Hunters, Marauder Chariots units
	(all armies)

Missile Resistance: +10% for Marauder Hunter, Whaler, and Marauder Horsemen units
	(all armies)

technology.short_description: These warriors zealotry pleases the Dark Gods greatly and eases their path to glory.

effects.description:
Enables "Discouraging" Attacks for Berserkers, Crimson Skull Cultists, and Skull Binders units
	(all armies)

Magic Resistance: 10% for Aspirants units
	(all armies)

Enables "Causes Fear" Attribute for Marauder Champions and Marauder Horsemasters units
	(all armies)

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.

technology.short_description: Along centuries, Wulfrik has plundered all manner of arcane artifacts and magical weapons, the most powerful of which are those warped by the touch of Chaos.

effects.description:
Enables Magical Attacks for Huskarls, Huskarls (Spears), Huskarls (Halberds), and Mounted Huskarls units
	(all armies)

Missile Resistance: +10% for Dragonship Reavers, Ice Wolves Chariots, and Hung Raiders units
	(all armies)

Enables "Blinding" Attacks for Huskarls, Huskarls (Spears), and Mounted Huskarls units
	(all armies)

technology.short_description: When Throgg marches to war, his legions of trolls and mutated beasts leave only broken bodies and twisted wreckage in their wake.

effects.description:
Vigour Loss Reduction %-n% for Norscan Warhounds, Bloodhounds, Ice Wolves, Norscan Trolls, and Norscan Ice Trolls
	(all armies)

technology.short_description: Demonic sinew and ectoplasmic blood lend Norscan monsters a speed in battle quite at odds with their enormity.

effects.description:
Speed: +10% for Manticore, Giant, Frost Wyrm, Mammoth units
	(all armies)

technology.short_description: Diabolical wards of protection can turn aside the enemy's blows.

effects.description:
Ward Save: +5% for Skinwolves, and Fimirs units
	(all armies)

technology.short_description: Seafang's progress through the Chaos Realms requires unwavering faith and unerring devotion to Wulfrik, both steadied by the presence of one's brothers in carnage.
"What it senses, we do. In its sudden turn, our infallible response. In its knowing malice, our own."
"Our flesh is stronger than we know, our blades sharper. We will test them. We *must* test them, against mortal and immortal alike."
"We make our Shamans' dreams real. Yet there was always a way for them to do it themselves. They have been shown the way."
"The cold has made us hardy. The Crow will make us invincible."
Nowhere else but under the shadow of Chaos are such brutish and degenerate killers nurtured and bred.

effects.description: Invalid Effect
Recruitment cost: -4% for Norscan Trolls, Norscan Ice Trolls & Fimir Warriors units

technology.short_description: Sharper throwing-axes forged in larger numbers mean more dismemberment and decapitation on the battlefield.

effects.description: Missile strength: +10% for Marauder Missile units
Ammunition: +15% for Marauder Missile units

technology.short_description: The correct expertise and equipment enables the Marauders' swift, blood-fed steeds to be ridden at their greatest speeds.

effects.description: Speed: +10% for Marauder Chariot & Marauder Cavalry units
Charge bonus: +10% for Marauder Chariot & Marauder Cavalry units

technology.short_description: A piece of armour is no harder than the anvil upon which it is fashioned.

effects.description: Armour: +5 for all Marauder units

technology.short_description: Every new war brings the Marauders bloody, gore-drenched glory in battle, whether in victory or in death.

effects.description: Income from post-battle loot: +15%
Recruit rank: +1 for Marauder units

technology.short_description: To pierce the heart of a Norscan stronghold is a challenge they themselves impose on their would-be attackers as but another form of slaughter.
Sometimes it is enough to know, and wait. The opportunity for bloodshed always comes, sooner or later.
The smell of blood rouses a raider's spirit; the promise of mead bolsters it further; the sight and sound of the sea assures him fully that victory awaits.
Sailing into the unknown is always easier with more space for supplies.

effects.description: Income from sacking settlements: +15%

Immune to High Seas attrition
	(all armies)

technology.short_description: "Those who are not of our own stock, we pillage and destroy. Those who are, we master."

"Predators? We are them. Beasts?...
	We *are* them."
"Those who call themselves the Warriors of Chaos... Once they served. Do they serve yet? We care not. We only serve ourselves. This is *true* Chaos."
Prolonged exposure to the dark energies of the bitter, frozen north creates the toughest and most monstrous freaks.

effects.description: Invalid Effect
Recruitment cost: -5% for Norscan Trolls, Norscan Ice Trolls & Fimir Warriors units

technology.short_description: Norscans are well-known for scoffing at fatigue in battle and revelry. Few would surmise the same attitude is put into their watchfulness, as well.
The sharp-minded amongst the tribes of the frozen wastes hint at the greater purpose behind their apparently indiscriminate acts of violence.
Once a Norscan's purpose is established, they can set about exacting the means in a much more deliberate manner.
A presentiment of a triumphant revelry fans the flames that would feed its fires.
"The Four are always watching. Eagles' eyes reflected in the fires of revelry, hounds baying at roasting flesh, crows circling above the morsels, serpents slithering among the flames…"
"...we multiply, so we may bury the mortal world under crimson ice."
The Four watch, always. What they deign to see depends on the power and Ruinous purpose of those who are watched.
With sorcerous secrets revealed, the Balefiends will be drawn - like moths to a flame.

effects.description: When normally killed in action, your Heroes will be wounded instead
Income from raiding: +40%
Hero capacity: +2 for Fimir Balefiends

technology.short_description: Crows who make the north their home, despite the cleverness and frailty inherent to them, are seen as no mere crows.
Dissolution in the face of Chaos holds no terror for Norscans. It is a reminder of their devotion and a call to foster strength.
Weapons and armour are not the only apparatus of war – so too are the tools used to forge them.

effects.description: Recruitment cost: -5% for Marauder Infantry units

technology.short_description: The true implements of slaughter are those who toil to fashion them – whether they like it or not.
The arrogance of these Elves, they think they know how to deal pain? We shall show them true pain!

effects.description: Melee defence: +6 when fighting against Dark Elves
Missile resistance: 10% when fighting against Dark Elves
Double experience gain for units when fighting against Dark Elves

technology.short_description: Svengar’s defeat at L’Anguille was an age ago - the Bretonnian Dukes shall soon fall!

effects.description: Leadership: +5 when fighting against Bretonnia
Bonus vs Large: +3 when fighting against Bretonnia
Double experience gain for units when fighting against Bretonnia

technology.short_description: The soft men of the Empire think themselves the pinnacle of civilisation – time to bring them down a notch!

effects.description: Upkeep: -5% for Marauder units
Leadership aura size: +25% when fighting against Empire
Melee attack: +4 when fighting against Empire

technology.short_description: They merely adopted the cold – we were born in it, molded by it.

effects.description: Leadership: +6 when fighting against Kislev
Charge bonus: +20% when fighting against Kislev
Double experience gain for units when fighting against Kislev

technology.short_description: Let them feel the hammer not on anvil, but on flesh. Let the molten industry be consumed by flame!

effects.description: Armour: +10 for Marauder Hunters, Marauder Berserkers and Marauder Champions units

Ward save: 5% when fighting against Chaos Dwarfs
	(all characters)
Double experience gain for units when fighting against Chaos Dwarfs

technology.short_description: A hunter without knowledge of his quarry is like a warrior without knowledge of his enemy.

effects.description: Unlocks level 2 Monster Hunts
Recruitment cost: -5% for Norscan Giant, Chaos Frost Dragon and Mammoth units

technology.short_description: For some abominations of the north, a mere whiff of blood is enough to lose all restraint.

effects.description: Melee attack: +4 for Skin Wolf, Norscan Ice Wolves & Norscan Warhounds units
Weapon strength: +5% for Skin Wolf, Norscan Ice Wolves & Norscan Warhounds units

technology.short_description: Everyone and every *thing* can earn their seat at a feast, but keeping it is a matter of some skill – and some luck in who or what you sit next to.
The only fit fate for these preening, foppish beanpoles is to be cut, cleaved and butchered.

effects.description: Melee attack: +4 when fighting against High Elves
Spell resistance: 15% when fighting against High Elves
Double experience gain for units when fighting against High Elves

technology.short_description: From afar, let us watch the sweet flame engulf their precious tree-kin!

effects.description: Weapon strength: +8% when fighting against Wood Elves
Missile resistance: 20% when fighting against Wood Elves
Double experience gain for units when fighting against Wood Elves

technology.short_description: Clogging up the land with soulless vessels, the Vampires and their Necromantic allies are a scourge to be eradicated.

effects.description: Attrition: -25% casualties suffered from Vampiric territory attrition
Melee defence: +5 when fighting against Vampire Counts
Double experience gain for units when fighting against Vampire Counts

technology.short_description: Entrenched in their Holds, the stunties fiercely protect their lucrative mines, offering both a good fight and valuable plunder.

effects.description: Vigour loss reduction: -15% for Cavalry units
Leadership: +5 during subterranean intercept battles
Weapon strength: +5% when fighting against Dwarfs

technology.short_description: The North offers rest to its weaker whelps atop the bone heap. The strong, brindled with scars and blood-ravened, dare anyone to tame them, or die.
The more long-lived a Troll, the more indomitable its constitution, and the more pregnable it is to the bolstering energies of Chaos.
Placation is the only language spoken by some creatures in the Norscan ranks. It is spoken very slowly, while looking them in the eye.
Scars may cripple a human, but it is how Northern creatures who were once less-than-human become so much more.
Only one voice can silence the baying, braying, screeching and screaming hordes of Norsca. One who must deserve the right to call on them.
Let nothing remain of us but the ice in our hearts.

effects.description: Attribute: Immune to Psychology

related_attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

effects.description: Attrition: -33% casualties suffered from all attrition
Unit mass: +15%

technology.short_description: With their name, Norscans instil dread. With their acts, they enact terror. With what they leave behind, they breed horror.
What Norscans leave behind is blood and gore. What Norscans take is something more than that.
Whether it is material wealth, or just good ideas, all manner of assets can be stolen from organised men.

effects.description: Research rate: +15
Upkeep: -5%
Global recruitment capacity: +2

technology.short_description: When the Marauders’ eagerness for despoilment is nurtured, vast distances can be covered between raids.

effects.description: Campaign movement range: +10%

technology.short_description: Let them build their Bastion; let them muster their pampered peoples. In time, all shall be rubble and corpses.

effects.description: Vigour loss reduction: -66% when fighting against Cathay
Missile resistance: 10% when fighting against Cathay
Double experience gain for units when fighting against Cathay

technology.short_description: "...Where ends the endless rowing, raging, ravaging? Only the blood can show. What does it show? Only the Shamans know…"
In the North, the stars may sometimes become unmoored in the sky, pointing the way for Norscans who know what it means.
The stars point the way. The land accommodates itself to those who follow it.
Whether fighting at sea or on land, the longship Marauders are the most seasoned veterans of the Norscan tribes.

effects.description: Leadership: +4 for Marauder units

technology.short_description: “Once you’ve rowed the breadth of the Middle Sea a few times, relentless slaughter does little to tire you…”

effects.description: Vigour loss reduction for Marauder Infantry units

technology.short_description: Give a captive a sword and he becomes an expendable sparring partner.

effects.description: Melee attack: +4 for Marauder units
Melee defence: +6 for Marauder units

technology.short_description: Experience in swinging your weapon on the roiling seas proves to yield devastating results when braced by solid ground.
Some who die under the Hound’s eye, do not truly die. One needs only the strength to withstand both their wounds and their resurrection.
The war never ends because combatants slain are rarely dead for long...

effects.description: Attrition: -25% casualties suffered from Vampiric territory attrition
Casualty replenishment rate: +15%
Income from sacking settlements: +15%

technology.short_description: "…And what do the Shamans know? The more we row, and rage, and ravage, the more the blood can show, the more the Shamans know, where ends the endless…"
Being set upon by a band of Norscan hunters is little different from being hunted by a pack of wolves, with a similarly violent outcome.
To some, the brutal landscape of Norsca is a useful impediment to the warping Chaos Wastes. Others seek to overcome it for a sliver of the power from beyond.
Gusts and currents carry Norscans forth. But what drives them is the Winds.
The Winds speak with the voices of the Powers that engendered them. Baying, whispering, and gurgling and tempting.
Hunt the cold-bloods, defile their sacred spaces, pillage and take all we can!

effects.description: Income from post-battle loot: +15%
Leadership: +6 for Marauder units when fighting against Lizardmen
Bonus vs Large: +3 when fighting against Lizardmen

technology.short_description: Deserts are for the dead, but the tomb-lurkers insist they live. Show them the truth.

effects.description:
Immune to Desert attrition
	(all armies)
Leadership aura size: +25% when fighting against Tomb Kings
Weapon strength: +5% when fighting against Tomb Kings

technology.short_description: Slaughter the ratmen - the step-children of our Dark Lords. We are the true inheritors!

effects.description: Bonus vs Infantry: +3 when fighting against Skaven
Charge bonus: +10 for Skin Wolves, Norscan Ice Wolves & Norscan Warhounds units
Double experience gain for units when fighting against Skaven

technology.short_description: The Greenskins’ love for war almost matches that of the Norscan tribes – let savagery be met with savagery!

effects.description:
Immune to Barren Wasteland attrition
	(all armies)
Missile strength: +10% when fighting against Greenskins
Physical resistance: 10% for Marauder Infantry units when fighting against Greenskins

technology.short_description: So fat and satisfied – their dedication to the Great Maw blinds them from the truth marching to their mawstep.

effects.description: Melee attack: +4 when attacking
Bonus vs Large: +3 when fighting against Ogres
Double experience gain for units when fighting against Ogres

technology.short_description: The eerie green glow of the Dark Moon calls out all manner of feral monstrosities from the Norscan wilderness.

effects.description: Recruit rank: -5 for Skin Wolf, Norscan Ice Wolves & Norscan Warhounds units
Melee defence: +6 for Skin Wolf, Norscan Ice Wolves & Norscan Warhounds units

technology.short_description: For those who dwell in the shadow of Chaos, monster hunting is a most savage pleasure.

effects.description: Unlocks level 1 Monster Hunts
Recruit rank: +1 for Norscan Warhounds & Norscan Ice Wolves units

technology.short_description: "...War begins where Chaos does. The source of blood and pain, Winds-torn, flesh-worn, sea-borne, it carries on..."
No one knows how Wulfrik and his vessel are bound to each other. As his crew grows, newcomers are quickly warned not to ask.
The secret to taming the horrors of the Wastes is as simple as it is difficult to obtain. Find the line between fearlessness and madness. Straddle it. Do not fall.
Tree trunks or boulder-fashioned bludgeons never outlast the Giants who brandish them. Custom-made armaments, while comical from afar, are terrifying to behold up close.
The Ettins' curse may have rendered them near-immortal. Then again, it may have been their pure, ravening spite at the world, and themselves.
Few creatures have endured such depredation from human and inhuman hunters alike – a Mammoth dies on its own terms and no one else's.
“To kill the beast, you must think like the beast."

effects.description: Invalid Effect
Unlocks level 3 Monster Hunts
